# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the code in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(words, text_width=10) 
    result = IOBuffer()
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " "$word) > text_width
            write(result, line * "\n")
            line = ""
        end
        line *= " "$word
    end
    write(result, line * "\n") # add the last line 
    return String(take!(result)) # convert IOBuffer to string and return it
end
```
The function `wrap_string` iterates over words. If adding a word would exceed `text_width`, we start a new line with write(result, "\n") and reset the line "line". We then continue on our current line until reaching the end of the input list of words. 

Here is an example usage:
```julia
words = ["Hello", "world!", "This", "is", "a", "test."]
println(wrap_string(words))
```
The output should be:

```shell
Hello world!
This is a test.
```
